name: Qian Lou
content: Qian Lou Qian Lou Director of Unbounded AI Lab at UCF and Assistant Professor Computer Science, Cyber Security and Privacy Cluster, University of Central Florida Email: qian.lou@ucf.edu, Office: HS2 234 Publications | Research Group | Teaching | Google Scholar | Patents Qian Lou is the director of the Unbounded AI Lab at the University of Central Florida, where he is a tenure-track assistant professor in the Department of Computer Science and a member of the Cybersecurity and Privacy Cluster. He brings both industry and academic experience, having earned his Ph.D. from Indiana University Bloomington and served as a senior research scientist at Samsung Research America. At UCF, he leads the Unbounded AI Lab with the mission of overcoming the bounds imposed by privacy, trust, and performance constraints on AI infrastructure and systems, enabling Confidential, Verifiable, and Efficient AI Computing at Scale. Developing effective approaches requires a confluence of disciplines: AI infrastructure, Secure computing, Efficient Intelligent Systems, etc: Secure AI Computing via Applied Cryptography and Trusted Hardware [NeurIPS'19, NeurIPS'20a, NeurIPS'20b, NeurIPS'20c, ICML'21, ICLR'21, US Patent, EMNLP'21, DAC'22, DAC'23, CCS'24 WAHC, CCS'24 LAMPS, S&P'25 (Oakland), NeurIPS'24 ] AI Infrastructure: Data, Models, Algorithms, and Hardware [ICCAD'18, DATE'19, ICLR'20, ASP-DAC'20, DATE'20, PACT'20 (Best Paper Nomination), IJCAI'21, ICLR'22a, CVPR'22, EMNLP'22, DATE'22, DAC'22, NANOARCH'22, ISQED'23 Invitation, PACT'24, MICRO'24 , US Patent, US Patent, US Patent ] Secure and Safe Large Language Models [CVPR'23, ICLR'23, NeurIPS'23, NAACL'24 , ECCV'24, ACL'24 , EMNLP'24a, EMNLP'24b, NeurIPS'24 ] News 09 / 2025 Our federated learning with encrypted aggregation (less than 2x overhead) is accepted by NeurIPS 2025, Congrats to Jiaqi. 08 / 2025 Our privacy-preserving data synthesis based on private computing is funded by NSF SaTC Crosscutting. 08 / 2025 Two papers are accepted by EMNLP 2026. Congratulations to Rochana and Mansour! 04 / 2025 Our LLM Application Security Testing (LAST) Framework is funded by DoD Pathfinder Program. 03 / 2025 Our system support for secure computing is funded by NSF CISE Core. 02 / 2025 One paper is accepted by DAC 2025. 01 / 2025 One paper is accepted by ICLR 2025. 10 / 2024 One paper is accepted by NeurIPS 2024. 09 / 2024 Two papers about Jailbreaking and Fairness Backdoor are accepted by EMNLP 2024. 09 / 2024 DataSeal is accepted by IEEE S&P 2025. 07 / 2024 One paper is accepted by MICRO 2024. 07 / 2024 WBP is accepted by ECCV 2024. 07 / 2024 SSL-Cleanse is accepted by ECCV 2024. 06 / 2024 BoostCom is accepted by PACT 2024. 05 / 2024 Congratulations to Jiaqi Xue and Yancheng Zhang, who started their internships at Samsung Research America. 05 / 2024 CR-UTP is accepted by ACL 2024. 03 / 2024 TrojFSP is accepted by NAACL 2024 (Oral in the main conference). 09 / 2023 TrojLLM is accepted by NeurIPS 2023. 02 / 2023 TrojViT is accepted by CVPR 2023. 02 / 2023 Primer is accepted by DAC 2023. 01 / 2023 TrojText is accepted by ICLR 2023. 10 / 2022 Weighted value decomposition on language model is accepted by EMNLP 2022. 03 / 2022 LITE-MDETR is accepted by CVPR 2022. 02 / 2022 MATCHA is accepted by DAC 2022. 01 / 2022 Language Model Compression is accepted by ICLR 2022. 01 / 2022 DictFormer is accepted by ICLR 2022. 08 / 2021 CryptoGRU is accepted by EMNLP 2021. 05 / 2021 HEMET is accepted by ICML 2021. 05 / 2021 Qian received a Luddy Outstanding Research Award. 09 / 2020 Three papers were accepted by NeurIPS 2020. Research Group Our research is driven by a talented, collaborative team. Ph.D. Students Mansour Al Ghanim (2021 Fall -) Jiaqi Xue (2023 Spring-) Rochana Prih Hastuti (2023 Fall-) Mayank Kumar (2024 Fall-) Hedong Zhang (2024 Fall-) Yifei Zhao (2024 Fall-) Prospective Students: We are recruiting two Ph.D. students and one postdoctoral researcher to join the Unbounded AI Lab at UCF. Interested applicants should email qian.lou@ucf.edu with the subject line:“2026 Prospective Member – Unbounded AI Lab at UCF”. Please include your CV and a summary of your research experience, interests, and notable accomplishments. We especially welcome applications from candidates in the United States and local regions. International applicants should also provide English proficiency scores (TOEFL/IELTS) and GRE results if required by UCF’s admission policies. For application details, please apply through the CS department and include my name as a possible advisor in your application. Have questions? Check out my answers to the PhD Advisor Guide.
